description: After the refinery, Phil, Earl and Axle have chosen to triple down on Pea Bois. Business is...well, was booming. Now they need to find the next hot sales opportunity.
shortDescription: Phil, Earl and Axle. Three peas in a podcoat.

dialogues.message: Who'd you like to s-pea-k to?
Mfmffhfmmf--
--ffmfmffmdff--
*gasp* sorry. Got stuck in the pod flaps. Whaddya want?
I don't mind being the middle pea.
I'm not the strong foundation, or the face of the business...
I'm just me. Earl. How's it goin'?
Yeah, I'm the top pea around here.
The boys thought I had the right charm to be the face of this operation.
And I mean... are they wrong? *wink*
How can Phil help you today?
Phil, Earl and Axle, at your service!
How can Phil help you today?
Earl, here. Looking for a tune up?
Mffphffis - UGH! Listen, it's Axle! I need-
You and fighting-evil-in-the-name-of-good. Like two peas in a pod.
Still seeking vengence, huh? Earl can understand that.
Mmmff! Mfff - Ruckus? What happened to the Chums?

description: Peely's been rescued. The gods, banished. Megalo Don, humbled. And now the Island faces Doom. It's time to set aside vengeance, and slip into something a little more heroic. It's time for Captain Jones.
shortDescription: Take up the shield of justice.

dialogues.message: I think I'm done with vengeance. Time for some justice.
I guess it's us vs. Doom, huh? Bring it on!
I think I'm done with vengeance. Time for some justice.
I figured out that there's more to life than vengeance.
It felt really good to be mad, for a long time. But I'm done with that.
It's been a minute since I've had to face down an apocalypse. Ah, nostalgia...
You can call me Captain Jones. And check out... wait, where'd I put that shield...?
Hope's facing down her proper supervillain. I'm so proud!
You're doing great, kiddo. Keep up the fine work.
See what 'a strong hand' gets you? Villains, every time. Duh.
What would ya like to know?
If I never get sassed by that sentient bowl of soup again, it'll be too soon.
That said, I respect her... even if her 'prophecies' don't tell us much.
At least THIS ally isn't going to betray us and try to shoot me. I hope.
Though honestly, I'd love to see her try.
Hope's coming into her own as a hero, and I'm really proud of her.
I remember those pressures. Saving the world is a heavy burden to bear.
I was like, "Why me?" "I'm just a guy!" "Who are all these heroes flying around in hi-tech suits?
She's ready. I know she is. And we'll have her back every step of the way.
I can't say I'm a big fan of the guy, for obvious reasons.
He's not gonna win. I don't think. You always expect one of these to be your last, I guess.
But Hope and the Avengers and the whole team, have got that. I believe in us.

description: Having barely escaped Saskia's grasp, Triage Trooper is trying his best to provide healing to those who are in need of his services. But can he escape the past that made Field Surgeon send Saskia looking for him in the first place?

dialogues.message: Ask me anything. I'm an open medkit.
Listen, about what I did...
I don't agree with you. Your whole vendetta against mortals.
It kind of goes against my personal interests. You know, as a mortal myself.
But you were hurt. I couldn't just NOT save you. No matter what Field Surgeon thinks.
Field Surgeon hired Saskia to find me.
She's...not too happy about something I did. Someone I saved.
But even after everything he did? He was still hurt.
God or not, I help those who need me.
You hurt? I could fix that.
Happy to lend a healing hand!
You hurt? I could fix that.
I'm always here to help! Just ask Field Surgeon.
If you're looking for some heals, I'm your man!
Tell Field Surgeon I get the message. I'm done running.
I know we don't agree on what I did, but we can still be friends. Right...?
Zeus! It's... good to see you up and about.

description: The wasteland was not really Centurion's thing: chaos, sand, a general lack of order. But everyone coming together to fight a supervillain? Now THAT Centurion is excited for!
shortDescription: Hazard Platoon's extraction expert and munitions master.

dialogues.message: Now THIS is more like it!
I'm Centurion. And I'm ready to help you take on Doom.
Now THIS is more like it!
I was a terrible wastelander. It's good to feel like a soldier again.
A hopeless war against a terrifying villain? WAY more my jam than some big chaotic wasteland.
I got bored of the wasteland aesthetic pretty fast anyhow.

description: The last of the pantheon to remain on the Island, Artemis has grown too fond of its denizens to leave them to suffer under Doom's wrath. But what secrets does the goddess of the moonlit hunt still hold?

dialogues.message: You're getting quieter, little mouse. I'm impressed.
Well met, little mouse.
You and The Oracle have developed a kinship. Seems appropriate given your... lineage.
You have been a joy to hunt. Let's not end this dance prematurely.
You have changed the world, Medusa. Be ready to shape a better one.
You're getting quieter, little mouse. I'm impressed.
The hunt awaits us.
I have not taken mortals as hunting companions in eons. Mayhaps I will change that...
Ask away, mortal.
The story of their lineage is not mine to tell.
Suffice to say, every family in The Society had their ties to the pantheon.
Diluted into myth over eons, fragile as gossamer, and ultimately pointless.
Hope will need more than an ancient lineage to recapture this Island from Doom.
Doom is powerful and brilliant, but arrogant.
The Oracle and her pet mortal, Hope, will defang him.
Suffice to say, every family in The Society had their ties to the pantheon.
My family have scattered to the infinite corners of reality.
Humbled, but free of Zeus' tyranny. It will be good for them.
For Zeus, too, though his pride and vanity cost him his immortality.
I have grown fond of this Island and its denizens. I will stay.

description: Fresh out of the experimental lab, Peelverine isn't about to let Doom ruin his new-found freedom. He's a fighting nana, and the way he sees it, this island is worth fighting for.
shortDescription: Nanamantium infused skeleton with a ripen-eration mutant ability.

dialogues.message: (Peelverine flexes his nanmantium claws.)
Try your luck against me, bub. I dare you.
(Peelverine flexes his nanamantium claws.)
My ripen-eration mutation keeps me bruise free.
What do you got to say there, bub?
(Peelverine smirks at the man in a suit of gizmos.)
(Peelverine stares into his own reflection. He flexes.)
Ready to go to work?
There's a time for scrappin'. I know that better than anyone.
(Peelverine squints and nods.)
(Peelverine looks off into the distance.)
(He sighs, then pats himself on the peel.)
It's hard knowing you're as feriocious and wild as a wolverine.
Yet as soft and delicious as a banana.

description: Ruckus' wastelander group, Chiara's Chums, has disbanded, leaving Ruckus alone to create his own solo thing. He is Ruckus the Rabbler!! and he is... kind of lonely, actually.

dialogues.message: Who needs leader when Ruckus can be leader AND follower?
I am Ruckus!! THE LONE RABBLER!!!
Who needs leader when Ruckus can be leader AND follower?
Cause Ruckus! Rouse rabble! BE FREE!!
Ruckus the Rabbler follows his own path now!
The Chums disbanded without telling Ruckus...
Without the Chums, Ruckus stands alone...
Ruckus yearns for his Chums... but he must be alone...
Hmm?
Long ago, Ruckus belonged to Chiara's Chums!
But the Chums disbanded. Without telling Ruckus.
Now Ruckus is RUCKUS THE RABBLER! And he walks ALONE!!
Unless... you walk with Ruckus for a while...?

description: Being the subject of a world-ending prophecy is tough, but Hope is tougher... she hopes. As her faceoff with Doctor Doom looms ever nearer, Hope is focused on assembling reality's finest heroes to join her in battle. Will you squad up?

dialogues.message: Any news?
Doom won't get away with this.
Any news?
You got something for me?
You're back. What's up?
Come to give me ANOTHER pep talk?
I'm glad you're here. Are you ready for The Underground's final ride?
Hey, buddy. Glad you're still fighting at my side.
I'm glad to have you, and the rest of The Underground, beside me in this fight.
How can I help?
I can't say I recommend being the subject of a prophecy.
It's... pretty terrifying.
Plus, now I have to run all of my life decisions past a sentient glass of water.
A very wise glass of water. But a glass of water nonetheless.

description: A Wastelander without a Wasteland is like a grain of sand without... um... a big pile of sand! Rust misses his home terribly, but he'll find a new place to belong. He's sure of it.

dialogues.message: I miss the thrashin', scrappin' sands...
The wasteland is gone... in spirit, at least...
I miss the thrashin', scrappin' sands...
This place is so different now.
*sigh* I got sand in my teeth again. Just like old times.
Doom took down the wasteland. So we gotta take down Doom.
I'm ready to rock.
Sure, he got rid of Megalo Don...
...but he crushed the spirit of the Wasteland along the way.
He'll pay for that. I'll do whatever it takes to help Hope take him down.
The spirit of the Wasteland blew up with the pipeline.
Sure the sand is still there, but... it's just not the same.
I'll find somewhere else that gives me that rowdy feeling... I just know it.

description: DEBUG - Collect 'em. This text needs to be replaced.
shortDescription: DEBUG - Never forget your first copy. This text needs to be replaced.

dialogues.message: Default conversation.
First ever conversation.
Outfit reaction.

description: Turning her back on her Society brethren, Nisha has... reluctantly... joined Hope and The Underground in the fight against Doom. Even if the aesthetic isn't really her thing.
shortDescription: An honorable duelist in a dishonorable Society.

dialogues.message: Ask away. I cannot afford secrets now anyhow.
You mean, if we win against this Doctor Doom?
My estate is gone. Kavel and I have been left with nothing.
But I have my brother, my foil, and my keen mind, so...
We will build a new future, if we have to.
Growing up, Hope was not what you'd call a 'natural leader'.
Once she grew a conscience, she became... unpopular with our peers.
If her family's background wasn't impeccable... ah, but enough about that.
She's growing into leadership now, it seems. She'd better not falter.
Yes, I have... reluctantly... joined Hope's little rebellion.
She has a point. The Society was good to its members. Not so much anyone else.
And Doom offers a compelling shared villain, of course.
I... don't hate the idea of a better, kinder world.
I do not miss The Society... but sometimes I miss knowing the hierarchy of things.
I am Nisha, newly of The Underground. Much to my chagrin.
I do not miss The Society... but sometimes I miss knowing the hierarchy of things.
I thought the Island could use a strong hand. Doom has proven that analysis... flawed.
This Island is swarming with superheroes. They can be a bit much.
I guess this is the start of my rebellious phase. Hm.
I will work with you, Hope. But that does not make us friends.
Our parents would despise The Underground. That... almost makes this fun.
I am sorry about your banana friend. For what that's worth.
It feels odd to say, but you seem... freer, now that you're on your own.
I've thrown in with The Underground. If you cannot beat them, etc.
I heard you helped dethrone a god. You seem like someone I should know.
I'll put down my foil if you'll put down your bow. Allies?
You're part of The Underground? That's... wonderful...
I'm Nisha. I'm new to The Underground. Which I imagine you'd guessed.

description: Brite Raider seems to be adjusting well to her post-wasteland environment. Sure, the Island is in peril, but at least she's not getting sand in her food anymore. Sandy snacks aside, she's ready to face the battle - and Doctor Doom - head-on.

dialogues.message: It's a brite one today.
This isn't the wasteland I remember...
What do you make of all this "Doom" stuff?
Hope! I heard you're, um, the subject of a prophecy?
It's a brite one today.
Hey there, Wastelander!
Brite Raider, at your service.
What do you wanna know?
So, the Wanderer was Doctor Doom this whole time?
I knew there was something up with him! Something BAD!
I have to say, I love that there's less sand on the Island now.
It was in my shoes, my hair, my food...
...and other places where sand should not go. Yikes.
Oh, my llamacorn from back home? He's a good boy.
...You know, except for the biting.

description: Rhodey, aka War Machine, is a seasoned veteran that's seen his fair share of bad guys with massive egos. Doom is no different. He'll win as he always has, with cutting edge tech and a little luck.
shortDescription: Ace pilot, military veteran, and trusted ally of Tony Stark.

dialogues.message: You got questions for me?
Being in this suit? I feel unstoppable. But...
I'd be lying if I said I enjoyed it all the time.
In here, I can be the hero I need to be.
But I miss just sitting at the controls. I miss being a pilot.
Trust me, I won't rust.
Looks like I really stepped in it this time.
Trust me, I won't rust.
I gotta get out there. Test my new toys.
Here I am, ready to save the day.
Nanamantium, huh? That's not contagious, right?
Did your prophecy mention anything about this?
Well, look at you! A real tin can off the old block.
Vengeance is sweet, but what comes next?
